newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha steady, physical market seen tight.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha steady, physical market seen tight.

text.p: NWE naphtha prices were steady on Tuesday but traders said supplies appeared tight ahead of November loading programmes.

Barges were assessed cif mean quotes plus 75 cents fob ARA. Nov swaps early were priced at $224/$225 before easing back to $223/$224, roughly unchanged from Friday, after a drop in crude prices, traders said.

"The barges still seem to be tight," a trader said. He said no Russian cargoes appeared on offer today. The cargo market looked a bit weaker for the second half of November, he added. -- John Hanley, London Newsroom +44 171 542 8185
